title: Personalized Learning Plan for Math and Mechanics
goal: Strengthen basic math skills to support understanding of mechanics while improving consistency in learning.

stages.title: Foundational Learning (Weeks 1-2)

topics.title: Introduction to mechanics (concepts like force, motion)

activities: **Math (10 min)**: Use online resources or apps (like Khan Academy) to practice basic arithmetic problems. Aim for 5-10 practice problems each night.
**Science (10 min)**: Watch a short YouTube video (5-7 mins) explaining key mechanics concepts, then summarize what you learned in 3-5 sentences.

stages.title: Intermediate Skills (Weeks 3-4)

topics.title: Unit conversions and basic geometry (area, perimeter)

activities: **Math (10 min)**: Solve practical problems involving unit conversions and area calculations (e.g., calculating the area of a rectangle). Aim for 3-5 problems focused on real-world applications.
**Science (10 min)**: Conduct simple experiments (like measuring the drop of a ball) and document the results, connecting the experiment to Newton's laws.

stages.title: Application and Problem Solving (Weeks 5-6)
stages.focus: Strengthening Concept Application in Real-World Scenarios

topics.title: Problem-solving with mechanics (calculating speed, distance, and time)

activities: **Math (10 min)**: Complete problems that involve setting up equations and solving for unknowns, with a focus on word problems.
**Science (10 min)**: Create a mini-project (like building a simple structure) to apply mechanics concepts. Document the process and the principles involved.

stages.title: Review and Deepening Knowledge (Weeks 7-8)
stages.focus: Mastery through Revisiting Concepts and Advanced Applications

topics.title: Review key math concepts (addition, subtraction, multiplying units)
Deeper exploration into forces and motion (e.g., friction, gravity)

activities: **Math (10 min)**: Take quizzes that cover all previously learned math concepts and mechanics applications.

**Science (10 min)**: Read a short article or chapter about advanced mechanics concepts and relate them to previous learnings. Write a brief reflection on how understanding these concepts can apply to everyday situations.
